intro: Ochthocosmus thollonii, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the island of Madagascar and is characterized by its vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy texture. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
